discussion.content: "A company runs a Linux server on a popular public cloud provider"Â´. They have a part of their infrastructure in the cloud, thats the definition of IaaS. Stop misleading people.
Anybody who has read a CompTIA N+ book knows its IaaS

comments.content: I agree, that's the definition of Hybrid Cloud nowdays, maybe not when these questions were written.

discussion.content: I am not sure this is a Hybrid case. It says that the company runs the servers on its own datacenter (not in a private cloud), and some on Public servers. Hybrid is a combination of Private and Public clouds, not on premise equipment and public clouding.

"company runs Linux servers in its own datacenter and also on a popular public cloud service provider", there's your hybrid.

requires authentication through their servers, there's your IaaS

also requires authentication and is
Iaas: ...also on a popular public cloud service provider

comments.content: 'A company runs Linux servers ""in its own datacenter'"

questions.question_text: A company runs Linux servers in its own datacenter and also on a popular public cloud service provider. The servers hosted by the cloud provider can only be accessed with proper authorization and are only accessed by the company's datacenter. Which of the following BEST describes the type of cloud architecture being used? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: The Virtual IP will be pointing to the active DB at any given time out of the DB farm/Cluster (Using the same Virtual IP address for the whole farm). so, when one DB is down, the stanby/secondary will assume the responsibility seamlessly, and using the same Virtual IP.
I'm gonna assume db in the case is database, which would have to be active in order to be accessed, for security reasons.
I had no clue what the answer could be.

comments.content: A virtualized server is used for HA for zero-downtime recovery.

choices.D: A private IP pointing to the web proxy
choices.A: A virtual IP pointing to the active DB
choices.C: A private IP pointing to the web front end
choices.B: A static IP pointing to the passive DB

questions.question_text: A company's web-based application has a database that is set up for high availability in case of a failure. Which of the following is necessary to achieve this type of setup?

discussion.content: IDF internal to the network and MDF external from the network from IPS provider to Demarc location.
what are the real differents between IDF & MDF?

comments.content: Ah, so is it safe to assume that by diagramming the core network room, that meant it was the MDF? Making the IDF(s) the auxiliary rooms?

IDF is an intermediate distribution frame, whereas your mdf is your main distribution frame. Your IDF(s) is/are typically located on the upper floors of a building whereas your MDF is typically on your bottom floor. Think of it as having a centralized location for all of your wiring on that floor, you can have multiple IDFs at different floors running to a MDF at the bottom floor.

questions.question_text: A network technician is creating a diagram of network termination points in the building. The technician diagrammed the core network room and now needs to diagram the auxiliary network closets. Which of the following is the technician MOST likely going to add to the diagram?
A network technician has installed multiple new lightweight access points across the network. Which of the following devices should the technician use to manage the new access points?

discussion.content: wireless controller - centralised management for AP

questions.question_text:
Management is concerned there is excessive traffic on the network. A network technician wants to run a quick port scan to see any systems that have open ports.
Which of the following tools should be used to do this?

discussion.content:
netstat use to display network connections for Transmission Control Protocol, routing tables, and a number of network interface and network protocol statistics. 
nmap -v for open ports

Selected Answer: D
netstat -ab is used to check for open ports

comments.content: Nmap is a Network mapping tool. That means it's used to discover informations about hosts on a network (their ip, open ports, etc). Whereas Netstat is a network statistic tool used to list active connections from and to your computer.

discussion.content: Why is the answer not D-netstat?
